data.title: Clicking edit icon in editable settings.json scrolls horizontally
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (c425cd159bd389844e9400be801675f54f2443c7, 2016-12-06T16:53:46.634Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

---

Testing #16530

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open settings
2. Pick any setting
3. Narrow the editable setting.json's editor such that the edit icon no longer fits on the screen
4. Place text cursor on a different line than the setting (important!)
5. Scroll horizontally to reach the setting's edit icon and click
-> Editor scrolls to reveal the first column (where the cursor is now placed)

data.title: Should TM_DIRECTORY in an untitled file should be '' instead of '.'?
data.body:
Have a snippet like

```
"test": {
  "prefix": "test",
  "body": "foo ${TM_DIRECTORY:bar}"
}
```

In an untitled file, `TM_DIRECTORY` resolves to '.'. Should it be empty, so we can use a default value instead?

3. Click the copy to settings drop down item

data.title: Multiple editors in a single tab feel awkward, how do you navigate between the two editors?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
#16530

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (c425cd159bd389844e9400be801675f54f2443c7, 2016-12-06T17:07:24.668Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-28-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.7.1|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.0|
|Theme-Wombat|gerane|0.0.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.10|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|
|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|

---

I'm a heavy user or ctrl+1, 2, 3 to focus the various editors available to me, when there is a tab with multiple editors especially when there is only 1 editor group ctrl+2 feels very strange as it opens a new editor tab. I don't know how to get focus into the default settings editor.

Assigning this to people involved in these split tabs as it's more of a general problem. Maybe I'm just missing something having not used the diff editor. I want a reliable way to focus either editor within a split tab and/or potentially making it more obvious that it's a split editor? If there is already a way to deal with this, is there a better way we could educate users like myself?

data.title: Launch widget dropdown gets white background in Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 insiders dated 12/6
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a launch config with more than 1 config
2. Expand the drop down and hover over the options (all is good)
3. Now continue hovering outside the expanded drop down

Boom: The drop down now has white background

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/20940441/9a295a0a-bba7-11e6-98a4-14da6465f4b2.png)

Not sure if this is an electron issue.

Mac is fine

data.title: Typescript Source formatting breaks @component structure in typescript and module fails to load
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: LSB Version:	core-9.20160110ubuntu0.2-amd64:core-9.20160110ubuntu0.2-noarch:printing-9.20160110ubuntu0.2-amd64:printing-9.20160110ubuntu0.2-noarch:security-9.20160110ubuntu0.2-amd64:security-9.20160110ubuntu0.2-noarch
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
Release:	16.04
Codename:	xenial

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Assuming that in vscode, user settings, "editor.formatOnSave": true 
2. from terminal run > ng new my-app
3. cd myapp
4. ng serve
5. open browser to localhost:4200 and you should see app works!
6. ctrl-c to stop
7. from terminal run > ng generate component my-component
8. from terminal run > code .
9. in vscode edit src/app/app.component.html adding <app-my-component></app-my-component> to the end of the html - ctrl-s to save
10: from terminal run > ng serve
11: refresh browser on localhost:4200 and you should see app works! and my-component works!
12: in vscode edit src/app/my-component/my-component.component.ts, adding just a line to the bottom of the file and save with ctrl-s.

Notice that the @component line has flattened the json from this:

@Component({
  selector: 'app-my-component',
  templateUrl: './my-component.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./my-component.component.css']
})

to this:

@Component({selector: 'app-my-component', templateUrl: './my-component.component.html', styleUrls: ['./my-component.component.css']})


13: let webpack rebuild and refresh your browser on localhost:4200 and notice the following error in the console: Uncaught Error: Cannot find module "."()
and the page never loads...

I believe the problem is with the way the @component structure is flattened and then typescript can't process it for some reason, or does so incorrectly. If this is a tsc bug, I'd be happy to open something there instead.

Thanks for any help or guidance. For now, I am just turning off format on save and won't autoformat my typescript components for the time being.

Honestly, if there were a way to keep ts formatting from combining the javascript object onto one line, I'd prefer it for readability. I'm assuming that it does the flattening because it is being passed to the @component method, but it is hard to see when long on the line like that.

It may also be that some extension is doing this, but I've disable beautify and any other installed extension that I could find that I suspect could cause this.

Best regards,

Hal

data.title: Tooling for snippet syntax (variables, choice, placeholders, ...)
data.body:
Testing - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15875

Is it possible to get intellisense for snippet variables in the 'body' field of snippets? Will make them much more discoverable.

data.title: Can not cancel when enabling the second keymap
data.body:
Testing #16559 

When install the second keymap, users start to know that multiple keymaps may have conflicts. Then they may just regret to install the second keymap, however, we don't have a way for them to cancel the installation.

data.title: Linux: Join line has shortcut Windows + J
data.body:
testing #16545, Linux

The short cut for Join Lines is Window +J. That's quite uncommon on Linux, I haven't see any other shortcuts using that key.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/20939006/7368acae-bbed-11e6-9294-df129b7ca12c.png)

data.title: Improve visual presentation of header area of settings editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (7499a9f3c565f4fbe5205e30c8664e5a5a11ae94, 2016-12-06T16:10:17.195Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open user settings
2. see yellow and pink in screenshot

Yellow: The interplay of the grey and white areas don't make it obvious that this is a single editor now. Particularly for users who have experienced the two editors opening in the past.
Pink: The separation between the two sides of the editor is rather subtle. It should be more prominent. Also the use of the shadow seems not to fit nicely in the overall UI design of Code.

![screen shot 2016-12-06 at 10 31 39 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4674940/20938371/b2890012-bb9f-11e6-98d3-5c46874fed0f.png)

data.title: Make port number a tab stop in Attach to Port launch snippet (node and node2)
data.body:
Testing #16214 

The port number seems to be a good candidate for a second tab stop (after the name). (Both `node` and `node2` snippets.)

data.title: Use common filename in Launch Program snippet's program property (node and node2)
data.body:
Testing #16214

The snippet has `"program": "${workspaceRoot}/Program"`, it would be clearer is it was using something that looks like a common filename: `"program": "${workspaceRoot}/server.js"` with `server.js` selected. This is for both `node` and `node2` adapters.

data.title: Simplify generated launch.json and set in template mode (node)
data.body:
Testing #16214, related #16171

I think the generated launch.json for Node would be less intimidating if it had only one configuration for "Launch Program" and came up in template mode, like after the snippet was inserted.

data.title: Closing tabs using mouse wheel click turns cursor into auto scroll

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open multiple files at a time until the tab menu is scroll-able.
2. Click on an open tab using the mouse wheel, the tab will close, but the cursor will turn into auto scroll (css: all-scroll) and when you move the mouse it will scroll the tab menu.

When closing tabs using scroll wheel click, I shouldn't need to click away to get a normal cursor.

data.title: fixes #16553
data.body:
@joaomoreno 

Did a quick test and this seemed to fix the problem I was having with the Vim extension

data.title: Tab completion fails in certain scopes
data.body:
Not sure if this has been reported, but it is a very odd specific case.

If you create a script (Untitled.ps1) and put one line in it $host.EnterNestedPrompt().
When you run the script you will enter a nested prompt, obviously, at that point if you create any variables you will not be able to tap complete to them.  You can see them with Get-VAriable and you can type them in manually to retrieve them, but tab completion fails.  This only happens with psreadline, if I remove the module while in the nestedprompt, tab completion works.  This can also affect debugging scenarios where you are nested as well.

Thanks

Bobby

data.title: Changelog not appearing

- VSCode Version: 1. She 7.2

I'm not sure if this a mistake on my part but for some reason my change log isn't appearing in the extensions marketplace. Nor, incidentally, can I see anybody else change log despite them being present for other users.

my extension is https://github.com/mat-mcloughlin/vscode-elixir and as far as I can tell I've defined the CONTRIBUTIONS.md file correctly
